attributes.additional_details: The pandemic has been difficult for students. Many of us are trapped in difficult environments unable to study properly. We have been under immense stress.Many students were abandoned without access to remote learning, support, resources and the ability to meaningfully study. The current provisions outlined are not enough and the justifications were insulting. We cannot be expected to sit our examinations without meaningful change, without it the prospects of an entire generation will be stunted
attributes.background:
We want :
Reform to the 2021 A-Level examinations. 
Current provision to be Reevaluated.
Delay to early application deadlines. 
More guidance to university 
applicants 
Acknowledgement of the difficulties faced by students (motivation is unrelated)
Meaningful change to be made to 2021 exams.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions which call for similar actions: 

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066

Create a taskforce to establish a fair process for 2021 university candidates: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548898 

Triple Lock for 2021 A Levels Exam Results: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548555

Ensure all 2021 examinations are based on teacher assessment only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549147

Do not delay A-level Exams: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549995

Open book exams for GCSE and A-level students sitting exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327397
